title: Portfolio Website Configuration Schema
description:
Comprehensive JSON Schema for portfolio website configuration including GitHub integration, project management, social media, resume sections, and UI customization. This schema provides validation, IntelliSense support, and documentation for all configuration options.

Copyright 2025 Krishna GSVV
Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0
You may obtain a copy at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

FEATURES:
- Dynamic GitHub project fetching with fallback to static projects
- Comprehensive social media integration
- Resume/CV management with multiple sections
- Customizable UI themes and animations
- SEO-optimized project metadata
- Mobile-responsive configuration options
- Accessibility features and validation

BEST PRACTICES:
- Use semantic technology tags (lowercase kebab-case)
- Include comprehensive project descriptions (50+ characters)
- Provide multiple project URLs (live, demo, documentation)
- Maintain consistent color schemes across social platforms
- Optimize images for web (prefer CDN URLs)
- Include accessibility labels for all interactive elements

TECHNOLOGY RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Frontend: React, Vue.js, Angular, Svelte
- Styling: Tailwind CSS, Styled Components, CSS Modules
- Backend: Node.js, Python, Java, Go, Rust
- Databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, Firebase
- Cloud: AWS, Azure, GCP, Vercel, Netlify
- DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, CI/CD

github.description:
GitHub API configuration for dynamic repository fetching. This enables automatic project discovery and keeps your portfolio synchronized with your latest work.

SETUP GUIDE:
1. Choose 'org' for organization repos or 'user' for personal repos
2. Set username to your GitHub username or organization name
3. Construct apiUrl: https://api.github.com/{orgs|users}/{username}/repos
4. Use descriptive userAgent for API identification

RATE LIMITS:
- Unauthenticated: 60 requests/hour
- Authenticated: 5000 requests/hour
- Consider caching for production use

type.description:
GitHub account type:
- 'org': Organization account (e.g., company, team, project group)
- 'user': Individual user account (personal repositories)

This affects the API endpoint structure and available repository types.

username.description:
GitHub username or organization name. Must follow GitHub naming conventions:
- 1-39 characters long
- Alphanumeric characters and hyphens only
- Cannot start or end with hyphen
- Cannot contain consecutive hyphens

apiUrl.description:
GitHub API endpoint for fetching repositories. Must be a valid GitHub API URL:
- For organizations: https://api.github.com/orgs/{org-name}/repos
- For users: https://api.github.com/users/{username}/repos

Ensure the URL matches your account type and username.

userAgent.description:
Custom user agent string for API requests. This helps with:
- API rate limiting and identification
- Analytics and usage tracking
- Debugging and monitoring

Use a descriptive name that identifies your portfolio site.

accessToken.description:
Optional GitHub Personal Access Token for higher rate limits and private repository access. Format: ghp_xxxxxxxxxxxx

Security: Store in Environment Variables, not in committed code!

cacheTimeout.description: Cache timeout for API responses in seconds (5 minutes to 24 hours). Helps with rate limiting and performance.

projects.description: Project display and data source configuration

mode.description:
Data source mode for projects:
- 'api': Fetch projects dynamically from GitHub API
- 'static': Use only manually configured staticProjects array
- 'hybrid': Use API with staticProjects as fallback when API fails

Recommendation: Use 'api' for active developers with public repositories, 'static' for curated project showcases, or 'hybrid' for reliability.

ignore.description:
Repository names to exclude from display (case-sensitive). Common excludes:
- Portfolio websites: 'username.github.io'
- Config repositories: '.github', 'dotfiles'
- Private/work projects: 'company-internal', 'client-work'
- Learning repositories: 'practice', 'tutorials', 'sandbox'
- Archived projects: 'deprecated-*', 'old-*'

maxProjects.description:
Maximum number of projects to display on the portfolio. Recommendations:
- 6-12 projects: Ideal for focused showcase
- 15-25 projects: Good for active developers
- 25+ projects: For comprehensive portfolios

Consider user experience and page load times when setting this value.
